==== Israel ==== Some 600 Israeli companies and 850 Israeli shareholders are listed. Among the Israeli names found in the leaked documents are top attorney [[Dov Weissglass]], who was the bureau chief of deceased prime minister [[Ariel Sharon]]; [[Jacob Engel]], a businessman active in the African mining industry; and [[Idan Ofer]], a member of one of Israel's wealthiest families, according to [[Haaretz]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/1.712914 |title=Israel to Probe Hundreds Implicated by Panama Papers |work=Haaretz.com |accessdate=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405154410/http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/1.712914 |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Weissglass' name appears as a sole owner of one of four companies set up by his business partner Assaf Halkin. The company, Talaville Global, was registered in the [[British Virgin Islands]] in May 2012, according to Haaretz, and seven months later, all of its shares were mortgaged against a loan from a [[Vienna]] bank.
Weissglass and Halkin told Haaretz that the company "was registered for the purpose of receiving a loan from the bank in order to invest in European properties. The bank would only allow a loan to a corporation... [the] company activity is reported to the tax authorities in Israel. The required tax on the said activity is paid in Israel."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/600-israeli-companies-850-shareholders-listed-in-panama-data-leak/ |title=600 Israeli companies, 850 shareholders listed in Panama data leak |work=The Times of Israel |accessdate=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405085825/http://www.timesofisrael.com/600-israeli-companies-850-shareholders-listed-in-panama-data-leak/ |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Many leaked documents reference [[Bank Leumi]], primarily its branch on the island tax haven of [[Jersey]]. One of its customers, billionaire [[Teddy Sagi]], made his fortune developing online gambling technology in England and recently developed the [[Camden Market]] commercial real estate space. Sagi is sole shareholder of at least 16 Mossack Fonseca offshore companies, mostly real estate ventures.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/world-news/1.712497 |title=Panama Papers: Hundreds of Israeli Companies, Shareholders Listed in Leaked Documents Detailing Offshore Holdings: Leaked documents of Panamanian law firm reveal shell companies linked to prominent Israeli lawyers and business persons |author1=Uri Blau |author2=Daniel Dolev |author3=Shuki Sadeh |date=April 3, 2016 |accessdate=April 25, 2016 |work=Haaretz |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425125244/http://www.haaretz.com/world-news/1.712497 |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Israeli businessman [[Beny Steinmetz]] was also a Mossack Fonseca customer, with 282 companies.
==== Pakistan ====
===== Nawaz Sharif ===== {{main|Panama Papers case}} [[File:Nawaz Sharif January 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|[[Nawaz Sharif]] – Former Prime Minister of Pakistan]]
[[Nawaz Sharif]] was the second top official to be ruled out as the result of information disclosures in the Panama Papers. Supreme Court disqualified him from office. One judge said that Mr Sharif was no longer "eligible to be an honest member of the parliament".<ref name="pk" /> Pakistan's ruling party, the [[Pakistan Muslim League (N)|Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N)]], was permitted by the speaker of the [[National Assembly of Pakistan|National Assembly]] to select an interim prime minister until the 2018 general election. The Supreme Court verdict was announced in the context of heightened security in the capital. Over 3,000 armed police and members of the [[Pakistan Rangers]] paramilitary force were deployed around the Supreme Court. The verdict followed months of dramatic news coverage and social media debates, the divisions falling largely along party lines.<ref name="pk" />
A hearing on October 18, 2017 resulted in an indictment for Sharif,<ref name=indictS>{{cite web|url=https://panamapapers.icij.org/20171020-pakistan-pm-sharif-indicted.html|publisher=ICIJ|author=Martha Hamilton|title=Former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif, Family Members Indicted|date=October 20, 2017|accessdate=November 12, 2017}}</ref> who has faced allegations of corruption since the 1980s. The Panama Papers corroborated a federal inquiry in the mid-1990s and name both [[Nawaz Sharif]] and his younger brother, Punjab chief minister [[Shebaz Sharif]]. They also link in-laws of Shebaz Sharif and children of Nawaz Sharif to offshore companies.<ref name="pklist">{{cite news |url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2016/04/04/national/panama-papers-list-of-pakistani-politicians-businessmen-who-own-companies-abroad/ |title=Panama Papers: List of Pakistani politicians, businessmen who own companies abroad |date=4 April 2016 |accessdate=17 April 2016 |publisher=Pakistan Today |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160413195121/http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2016/04/04/national/panama-papers-list-of-pakistani-politicians-businessmen-who-own-companies-abroad/ |archivedate=April 13, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="pk">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-40750671 |title=Pakistan's Sharif disqualified by court|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170728072203/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-40750671 |dead-url=yes |archivedate=July 28, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Mossack Fonseca records tie Nawaz' daughter [[Maryam Nawaz]] and her brothers Hussein and Hassan to four offshore companies, Nescoll Limited, Nielson Holdings Limited, Coomber Group Inc., and Hangon Property Holdings Limited.<ref name="CIRPApr416">{{cite news |url=http://cirp.pk/index.php/2016/04/04/the-panama-papers-pages-from-pakistan/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024911/http://cirp.pk/index.php/2016/04/04/the-panama-papers-pages-from-pakistan/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=April 6, 2016 |title=The Panama Papers: Pages from Pakistan |date=April 4, 2016 |work=Center for Investigative Reporting in Pakistan (CIRP) |accessdate=April 5, 2016}}</ref> The companies acquired luxury real estate in London during 2006–2007. The real estate was [[collateral (finance)|collateral]] for loans of up to $13.8 million, according to the Panama Papers.<ref name="WSJPakcoll">{{cite news |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/pakistan-prime-minister-upgrades-probe-into-panama-papers-affair-1461344499 |title=Pakistan Prime Minister Upgrades Probe Into Panama Papers Affair: Premier calls for a commission of inquiry made up of sitting judges, instead of retired |author=Saeed Shah |date=22 April 2016 |accessdate=22 April 2016 |publisher=Wall Street Journal |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422204559/http://www.wsj.com/articles/pakistan-prime-minister-upgrades-probe-into-panama-papers-affair-1461344499 |archivedate=April 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The prime minister's children say the money came from the sale of a family business in Saudi Arabia.<ref name="WSJPakcoll" /> But these offshore companies and assets were not disclosed on his family's wealth statement and the suspicion that the companies were meant to hide or launder ill-gotten wealth or to avoid taxes called Sharif's ethics into question.<ref name="pk" />
Prior to the ruling, [[Maryam Nawaz]] had tweeted denial of wrongdoing, adding that she did not own "any company/property abroad," except as "a trustee" in a brother's corporation, "which only entitles me to distribute assets to my brother Hussain's family/children if needed."<ref name=SamaaApr416>{{cite news |url=http://www.samaa.tv/pakistan/2016/04/i-do-not-own-any-company-or-property-abroad-maryam |title=I do not own any company or property abroad: Maryam Nawaz |date=April 4, 2016 |work=[[Samaa TV]] |accessdate=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024906/http://www.samaa.tv/pakistan/2016/04/i-do-not-own-any-company-or-property-abroad-maryam/ |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The leaked documents name her as a [[trustee]] of Nescoll, created in 1993, and Nielson, first registered in 1994. The two companies subscribed to Mossack Fonseca services in July 2006. Mossack Fonseca was managing Nescoll, Nielsen Holdings, and Coomber Group when the three companies obtained a £7 million mortgage from the Swiss bank, [[Deutsche Bank]] (Suisse) SA and purchased four flats in Avenfield House, at 118 [[Park Lane]] in London. Hassan, the other brother, bought Hangon Holdings and its stock in 2007 for £5.5 million; Hangon then bought property, financed through the [[Bank of Scotland]], at 1 Hyde Park Place in London.
Samina Durrani, mother of Shebaz Sharif's second wife, and Ilyas Mehraj, brother of his first, also figure in the documents. Habib Waqas Group/Ilyas Mehraj is listed as a shareholder with 127,735 shares in Haylandale Limited, registered July 24, 2003 in the Bahamas. Mehraj has denied knowing anything about "any company whether incorporated in the Commonwealth of Bahamas or anywhere else under the name: Haylandale Ltd."<ref name=pklist /> Rainbow Limited, the newest of the three offshore companies owned by Samina Durrani, was registered September 29, 2010 in the British Virgin Islands (BVI).<ref name=pklist/> Armani River Limited, registered in the Bahamas on May 16, 2002, describes its assets as "property in London, which is not currently rented."<ref name=pklist/> Assets of Star Precision Limited, registered in BVI May 21, 1997, were reported as "cash as the investment portfolio. We are also holding 1,165,238 shares in Orix Leasing Pakistan Limited."<ref name=pklist/>
Hussain Nawaz said his family won't hamper any investigation, and urged one of former president [[Pervez Musharraf]] as well.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1060176/nawazs-son-owns-london-apartment-offshore-companies/ |title=Nawaz's son owns London apartment, offshore companies |date=6 April 2006 |accessdate=18 April 2016 |publisher=Express Tribune |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406221413/http://tribune.com.pk/story/1060176/nawazs-son-owns-london-apartment-offshore-companies/ |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The government on April 15 announced an investigation by an inquiry commission of all Pakistanis named in the documents. Opposition politicians said a judge, not a retired judge, should investigate. Numerous judges [[judicial disqualification|recused]] themselves.<ref name=inv>{{cite news |url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1084862/offshore-irregularities-all-pakistanis-named-in-leaks-face-probe/ |title=All Pakistanis named in Panama Papers face probe |date=15 April 2016 |author=Irfan Ghauri |accessdate=18 April 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417204236/http://tribune.com.pk/story/1084862/offshore-irregularities-all-pakistanis-named-in-leaks-face-probe/ |archivedate=April 17, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> On 28 July 2017, the [[Supreme Court of Pakistan]], disqualified Sharif from holding office.
=====Benazir Bhutto===== The late [[Benazir Bhutto]] was also a Mossack Fonseca client. In 2001 the firm set up BVI company Petroline International Inc. for Bhutto, her nephew Hassan Ali Jaffery Bhutto, and her aide and head of security [[Rehman Malik]], who later became a Senator and Interior Minister in the government of [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]]. Mossack Fonseca had deemed Bhutto's first company, the similarly named Petrofine FZC, politically sensitive and "declined to accept Mrs Bhutto as a client."<ref name=MFBhutto>{{cite news |url=http://indianexpress.com/article/world/world-news/in-oil-for-food-shadow-benazir-bhutto-set-up-a-firm-too/ |title=In oil-for-food shadow, Benazir Bhutto set up a firm too |author=Jay Mazoomdaar |date=5 April 2016 |accessdate=17 April 2016 |publisher=Indian Express |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160416230235/http://indianexpress.com/article/world/world-news/in-oil-for-food-shadow-benazir-bhutto-set-up-a-firm-too/ |archivedate=April 16, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> A [[United Nations]] committee chaired by former US [[Federal Reserve]] head [[Paul Volcker]] had determined in a 2005 investigation into abuses of the [[Oil-for-Food Programme|oil-for-food]] program that Petrofine FZC paid US$2 million to the [[Iraq]]i government of [[Saddam Hussein]] to obtain US $115–145 million in oil contracts.<ref name=OfF>{{cite news |url=http://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/pakistan/panama-papers-benazir-bhuttos-oil-firm-paid-huge-bribes-to-iraqi-president-saddam-hussain-forb-contracts/ |title=Panama Papers: Benazir Bhutto's oil firm paid huge bribes to Iraqi President Saddam Hussain for contracts |date=4 April 2016 |accessdate=17 April 2016 |author=Ali Zain |publisher=Daily Pakistan |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160419125238/http://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/pakistan/panama-papers-benazir-bhuttos-oil-firm-paid-huge-bribes-to-iraqi-president-saddam-hussain-forb-contracts/ |archivedate=April 19, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
In 2006, the Pakistani [[National Accountability Bureau]] (NAB) accused Bhutto, Malik and Ali Jaffery of owning Petrofine, established since 2000 in [[Sharjah]], [[United Arab Emirates]]. Bhutto and the [[Pakistan Peoples Party]] denied it. In April 2006 an NAB court froze assets owned in Pakistan and elsewhere by Bhutto and her husband [[Asif Ali Zardari]], saying that the assets, totaling $1.5 billion, were the result of corrupt practices, and that Swiss charges of criminal money laundering filed in 1997 were still in litigation.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://redcatsboards.yuku.com/topic/16603/Court-orders-confiscation-of-Zardaris-entire-property#.VxQPh_gXAlK |title=Court orders confiscation of Zardari's entire property |date=2 April 2006 |accessdate=17 April 2016 |author=khaleejtimes.com}}</ref>
==== Palestine ==== Tareq Abbas, a son of [[Mahmoud Abbas]], the president of the [[Palestinian Authority]], was revealed to hold $1 million in shares of the Arab Palestinian Investment Company (APIC), an offshore company associated with the Palestinian Authority and partially owned by the Authority's [[Palestine Investment Fund]].<ref name=son>{{cite web |url=http://www.haaretz.com/middle-east-news/1.713347 |title=Panama Papers: Leaks Reveal Abbas' Son's $1m Holding in Company With Ties to Palestinian Authority |date= |work=Haaretz.com |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160619131126/http://www.haaretz.com/middle-east-news/1.713347 |archivedate=June 19, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
[[File:Hamad_Bin_Jassim.png|left|thumb|Sheik [[Hamad bin Jassim bin Jaber Al Thani]], former prime minister of [[Qatar]]]]
==== Qatar ==== [[Hamad bin Jassim bin Jaber Al Thani]], prime minister from 2007 to 2013, in 2002 acquired three shell companies incorporated in the Bahamas and another in the British Virgin Islands and through them moorage in [[Mallorca]] and a $300 million yacht named ''Al Mirqab''.<ref name=ForbesQatar>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/chloesorvino/2016/04/13/panama-papers-leak-helps-show-that-qatars-former-prime-minister-is-a-billionaire/#2c8eeff825ee |title=Panama Papers Leak Helps Show That Qatar's Former Prime Minister Is A Billionaire |author=Chloe Sorvino |publisher=''Forbes'' |date=April 13, 2016 |accessdate=April 23, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160420180845/http://www.forbes.com/sites/chloesorvino/2016/04/13/panama-papers-leak-helps-show-that-qatars-former-prime-minister-is-a-billionaire/#2c8eeff825ee |archivedate=April 20, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The Panama Papers indicate he owns or owned eight shell companies. Subsequent reporting by ''Forbes'' found that Al Thani bought $700 million in [[Deutsche Bank]] shares in 2014 through Paramount Services Holdings and in 2015 transferred roughly half the stock to Supreme Universal Holdings, owned by a relative who had left office as emir of Qatar, also in 2013.<ref name=ForbesQatar />
==== Saudi Arabia ==== [[File:Salman bin Abdull aziz December 9, 2013.jpg|thumb|upright|King [[Salman of Saudi Arabia]] ]]
[[Salman of Saudi Arabia|King Salman]] is mentioned in the leaks in relation to two companies based in the British Virgin Islands—Verse Development Corporation, incorporated in 1999, and Inrow Corporation, incorporated in 2002. The companies took out mortgages totaling over US$34 million and purchased properties in central London.<ref name=SalonClinton>{{cite news |title=With Saudi and Russian ties, Clinton machine's tentacles are far reaching, according to Panama Papers |url=http://www.salon.com/2016/04/08/with_saudi_and_russian_ties_clinton_machines_tentacles_are_far_reaching_according_to_panama_papers/ |newspaper=[[Salon (website)|Salon]] |date=8 April 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160502005935/http://www.salon.com/2016/04/08/with_saudi_and_russian_ties_clinton_machines_tentacles_are_far_reaching_according_to_panama_papers/ |archivedate=May 2, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> His role in the companies was not specified. BVI company Crassus Limited, incorporated in 2004, registered a yacht in London, named ''Erga'' after King Salman's palace in [[Riyadh]]. The vessel boasts a banquet hall and can comfortably sleep 30.<ref name=Velite /> King Salman is described in the documents as its "principal user".<ref>{{cite news |title=Saudi King, UAE President at the Center of the Panama Papers |url=http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/Saudi-King-UAE-President-at-the-Center-of-the-Panama-Papers-20160404-0024.html |newspaper=[[TeleSUR]] |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024709/http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/Saudi-King-UAE-President-at-the-Center-of-the-Panama-Papers-20160404-0024.html |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Former Crown Prince [[Muhammad bin Nayef]] is also named in the papers.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.france24.com/en/20160404-panama-papers-politicians-named-europe-africa |title=A world tour of the politicians named in the Panama Papers |publisher=[[France 24]] |date=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170822021758/http://www.france24.com/en/20160404-panama-papers-politicians-named-europe-africa |archivedate=August 22, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
The ''Irish Times'' found a link to Iran-Contra in the Panama Papers, in the persons of one of America’s most colourful political donors Farhad Azima and multi-billionaire [[Adnan Khashoggi]], who both employed Mossack Fonseca’s services, and were both important figures in [[Iran-Contra]] scandal.<ref>https://www.irishtimes.com/business/panama-papers-links-revealed-to-spies-and-iran-contra-affair-1.2599083</ref>
The Mossack Fonseca files show Khashoggi appeared as early as 1978, when he became president of the Panamanian company ISIS Overseas S.A. The documents reveal that Fonseca’s clients included Sheikh [[Kamal Adham]], Saudi Arabia’s first intelligence chief (1963-79), brother-in-law of King Faisal, who was named by a US Senate committee as the CIA’s “principal liaison for the entire the Middle East from the mid-1960s through 1979”. Adham controlled offshore companies involved in the [[Bank of Credit and Commerce International|B.C.C.I.]] banking sem as instruments for their official worcandal.<ref name="goldf">Will Fitzgibbon and Nicolas Richter: [https://panamapapers.sueddeutsche.de/articles/570e6affa1bb8d3c3495baf4 Panama Papers: CIA-Agents used companies from Panama] Operation Goldfinger, [[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]</ref>
==== Singapore ==== The [[Ministry of Finance (Singapore)|Ministry of Finance]] and [[Monetary Authority of Singapore]] said in a statement that "Singapore takes a serious view on tax evasion and will not tolerate its business and financial centre being used to facilitate tax related crimes. If there is evidence of wrongdoing by any individual or entity in Singapore, we will not hesitate to take firm action."<ref>{{cite web |title=Panama Papers: Singapore reviewing information, doing 'necessary checks' |url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/panama-papers-singapore/2669500.html |website=[[Channel NewsAsia]] |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406052035/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/panama-papers-singapore/2669500.html |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==== Sri Lanka ==== Sri Lankan Finance Minister [[Ravi Karunanayake]] said his panel will investigate Sri Lankan names that come up in the Panama Papers, as well as the 46 who appear in the 2013 Offshore Leaks, according to the ''Daily Mail'', since earlier leadership apparently did not do so. The country has many large outstanding foreign loans taken out under the administration of former president [[Mahinda Rajapakse]], and the current government recently had to obtain a US$1.5 billion [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]] bailout. Rajapakse has denied diverting funds. The current government came to power in January 2016 on an anti-corruption platform.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sri Lanka sets up panel to investigate 'Panama Papers' |date=May 1, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2016 |author=AFP |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3568455/Sri-Lanka-sets-panel-investigate-Panama-Papers.html |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20160726040317/http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3568455/Sri-Lanka-sets-panel-investigate-Panama-Papers.html |archivedate=July 26, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==== Syria ==== [[Rami Makhlouf]], a maternal cousin of [[Bashar Al-Assad]], was worth an estimated $5 billion before the [[Syrian Civil War]], and had control of 60% of the economy. He was subject to sanctions by the [[United States]] and the [[European Union]], and controlled Syria's oil and telecommunications business.<ref name="AJSyria">{{cite news |title=Panama Papers: How the Seychelles saved Syria |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2016/04/seychelles-saved-syria-160407085452247.html |accessdate=April 23, 2016 |work=Al Jazeera |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422161244/http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2016/04/seychelles-saved-syria-160407085452247.html |archivedate=April 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The [[US Treasury]] charged that Pangates, a company registered to him, supplied the Assad government with a thousand tonnes of aviation fuel.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.afr.com/business/banking-and-finance/the-panama-papers-parade-of-the-blacklisted-through-firms-client-list-20160401-gnw92s |title=The Panama Papers: parade of the blacklisted through firm's client list |author1=Will Fitzgibbon |author2=Martha Hamilton |work=Financial Review |date=April 5, 2016 |accessdate=April 27, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160510114314/http://www.afr.com/business/banking-and-finance/the-panama-papers-parade-of-the-blacklisted-through-firms-client-list-20160401-gnw92s |archivedate=May 10, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> However, the Makhloufs were able to continue to operate via Panama shell companies,<ref name="ESGoodwaySyria">{{cite news |last1=Goodway |first1=Nick |title=Panama scandal grows for HSBC over Syria links |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/business/panama-scandal-grows-for-hsbc-over-syria-links-a3218276.html |accessdate=April 23, 2016 |work=Evening Standard |date=April 5, 2016 |language=English |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160426014451/http://www.standard.co.uk/business/panama-scandal-grows-for-hsbc-over-syria-links-a3218276.html |archivedate=April 26, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> registered in the [[British Virgin Islands]], and so not subject to US law – however, on 9 May 2011, the EU issued its own sanctions, and these were extended by an order in council to the British Virgin Islands in July 2011.<ref name=GuardSyria>{{cite news |last1=Garside |first1=Juliette |last2=Pegg |first2=David |title=Mossack Fonseca serviced Assad cousin's firms despite Syria corruption fears |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/05/mossack-fonseca-panama-papers-rami-makhlouf-syria-assad-hsbc |accessdate=April 23, 2016 |work=The Guardian |date=April 5, 2016 |language=English |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423013703/http://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/05/mossack-fonseca-panama-papers-rami-makhlouf-syria-assad-hsbc |archivedate=April 23, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Mossack Fonseca decided 6 September to resign from Makhlouf's companies. By then, Makhlouf had already cut ties with his bank. HSBC told the law firm that the Swiss authorities had frozen Makhlouf's accounts, and that "they have had no contact with the beneficial owner of this company since the last 3 months".<ref name=GuardSyria/>
==== Thailand ==== The ''[[Bangkok Post]]'' reported that the "[[Anti-Money Laundering Office (Thailand)|Anti-Money Laundering Office]] (AMLO) is seeking information from its foreign counterparts regarding twenty-one Thai nationals reportedly included in a list of people worldwide using a Panama-based law firm apparently specializing in money laundering and tax evasion." It is not clear why AMLO is investigating only twenty-one. The Panama Papers include at least 780 names of individuals based in Thailand and another 50 companies based in Thailand. Some are foreigners or foreign-owned companies, but 634 individual addresses in Thailand appear in the documents that have surfaced to date, including the CEOs of giant companies [[Bangkok Land]] and Phatra Finance.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/920929/many-thais-implicated-in-global-scandal |title='Many' Thais implicated in global scandal |work=Bangkok Post |date=April 4, 2016 |accessdate=April 5, 2016}}</ref>
====Taiwan==== Investigations by ICIJ's sole [[East Asian]] partner ''CommonWealth Magazine'' in [[Taiwan]] found that at least 2,725 offshore companies had registered addresses in Taiwan. Ninety Taiwanese, including the singer and actor [[Nicky Wu]], were included in the papers.<ref>[http://www.storm.mg/article/99299 《天下》調查：巴拿馬文件沒有台灣政治人物 藝人吳奇隆卻榜上有名-台灣｜ICIJ 國際調查記者同盟｜巴拿馬｜天下｜巴拿馬文件｜吳奇隆-風傳媒-施孝衡] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160409003225/http://www.storm.mg/article/99299 |date=April 9, 2016 }} {{zh icon}}</ref> According to a report released by ''CommonWealth Magazine'', Wu used the firm Horizon Sky Technology, Ltd. to co-operate with Hong Kong-based Sun Entertainment Culture Limited ([[:zh:太陽娛樂文化|zh]]).<ref>{{cite news |title=Taiwan actor Nicky Wu set up offshore firm: Panama Papers |url=http://www.straitstimes.com/lifestyle/entertainment/taiwan-actor-nicky-wu-set-up-offshore-firm-panama-papers |accessdate=30 April 2016 |work=The Straits Times |publisher=China Post/Asia News Network |date=7 April 2016 |location=[[Taipei]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425211905/http://www.straitstimes.com/lifestyle/entertainment/taiwan-actor-nicky-wu-set-up-offshore-firm-panama-papers |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
The publisher concludes that: "Taiwanese companies and individuals are believed to be extensively using offshore shelters to avoid or evade taxes ... after scouring the Panama Papers documents that Mossack Fonseca has not been one of their main conduits. This time, it appears that big Taiwanese banks, law firms and accounting firms did not often use the services of Mossack Fonseca, which does not have a presence in Taiwan. The forty-six Taiwanese brokers that did work with Mossack Fonseca were relatively small-scale consulting firms operating in Greater China. Most of the Taiwanese entities that set up shell companies through the Panamanian law firm were small, unlisted companies or individuals."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.cw.com.tw/article.do?action=show&id=15079 |title=CommonWealth Magazine |publisher=English.cw.com.tw |date= |accessdate=2016-05-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160531210910/http://english.cw.com.tw/article.do?action=show&id=15079 |archivedate=May 31, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>

=== North America ===
==== Canada ==== Canadian prime minister [[Justin Trudeau]] has denied any involvement in the affair, saying he had "entirely and completely been transparent about mine and my family's finances. That is something I learned early on that Canadians expect from their leaders."<ref name="canada3">{{cite news |last1=Fife |first1=Robert |title=Trudeau says he does not have money in offshore accounts |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/trudeau-says-he-does-not-have-money-in-offshore-accounts/article29563513/ |accessdate=April 9, 2016 |agency=The Globe and Mail Inc. |publisher=The Globe and Mail |date=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160411095756/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/trudeau-says-he-does-not-have-money-in-offshore-accounts/article29563513/ |archivedate=April 11, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> [[Canada Revenue Agency]] said in a statement that its current tax evasion audits include "some Canadian clients associated with law firm Mossack Fonseca,"<ref name=cra>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canada-revenue-agency-panama-papers-tax-1.3521859 |title=CRA seeks Panama Papers to search for new clues about tax cheats |date=5 April 2016 |accessdate=18 April 2016 |publisher=CBC News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417075452/http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canada-revenue-agency-panama-papers-tax-1.3521859 |archivedate=April 17, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> and added that it would "communicate" with its treaty partners to obtain any further information that may not currently be in its possession." The CRA has tax treaties with 92 different countries and 22 Tax Information Exchange Agreements.<ref name="canada3"/><ref name=cra />
The [[Royal Bank of Canada]] (RBC) denied any wrongdoing associated with the 370+ clients it had referred to Mossack Fonseca over the years."We have an extensive due diligence process... RBC works within the legal and regulatory framework of every country in which we operate," said a bank spokesman.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/panama-papers-business-reaction-1.3519525 |title=RBC t wrongdoing after being named in Panama Papers:'There are a number of legitimate reasons' to set up foreign holding companies, bank spokesman says |publisher=CBC News |date=4 April 2016 |accessdate=18 April 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160418063322/http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/panama-papers-business-reaction-1.3519525 |archivedate=April 18, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> CEO [[David I. McKay|David McKay]] said the bank will review the four decades of documentation for any problems.<ref name="canada1">{{cite news |title=Royal Bank and BMO defend Canada's banking sector amid Panama Papers and Fintrac fine |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canadian-banks-panama-papers-1.3524836 |accessdate=April 9, 2016 |agency=CBC/Radio-Canada |publisher=CBC News |date=April 7, 2016 |quote=Canadian banks have "dramatically" beefed up anti-money laundering controls over the last seven to 10 years |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160409130923/http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canadian-banks-panama-papers-1.3524836 |archivedate=April 9, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="canada2">{{cite news |last1=Scuffham |first1=Matt |title=Royal Bank of Canada sets up team to scrutinize data exposed in Panama Papers leak |url=http://business.financialpost.com/news/fp-street/royal-bank-of-canada-downplays-oil-loan-losses-expects-crude-price-gains-to-hold |accessdate=April 9, 2016 |agency=O Canada |publisher=Financial Post |date=April 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160409043228/http://business.financialpost.com/news/fp-street/royal-bank-of-canada-downplays-oil-loan-losses-expects-crude-price-gains-to-hold |archivedate=April 9, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> CEO [[Bill Downe]] of the [[Bank of Montreal]] said "Canadian banks have 'dramatically' beefed up anti-money laundering control over the last seven to 10 years,"<ref name=conmebol/> and added that any link between Canadian businesses and the Panama Papers companies would have originated a long time ago, before Canadian banks took action to stop money laundering.<ref name="canada1"/>
Some individuals did surface in the leaked documents, according to ICIJ partner in the investigation ''Toronto Star''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2016/04/04/how-offshore-tax-havens-are-costing-canada-billions-of-dollars-a-year.html# |title=How offshore banking is costing Canada billions of dollars a year: An unprecedented leak of secretive offshore tax-haven data contains stunning new revelations about the diversion of wealth from government coffers to hidden bank accounts |author1=Robert Cribb |author2=Marco Chown Oved |date=April 4, 2016 |accessdate=May 2, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160424132135/http://www.thestar.com/news/world/2016/04/04/how-offshore-tax-havens-are-costing-canada-billions-of-dollars-a-year.html |archivedate=April 24, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
* John Mark Wright, a mutual fund broker, had three shell companies in the British Virgin Islands for handling profits from a mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo. * Eric Van Nguyen, a Montreal resident with registered companies in Samoa and another in the British Virgin Islands. He also faces fraud charges in the New York state in a penny stock scheme.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-09-11/eight-charged-by-n-y-in-290-million-pump-and-dump-plot |title=Eight Charged by N.Y. in $290 Million Pump-and-Dump Plot |author=Chris Dolmetsch |date=September 11, 2014 |accessdate=April 30, 2016 |publisher=Bloomberg |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160507001425/http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-09-11/eight-charged-by-n-y-in-290-million-pump-and-dump-plot |archivedate=May 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> * Brian Shamess, a sports physician from [[Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario|Sault Ste Marie]], used a Mossack Fonseca company to buy a condo on Panama Bay in 2011. * Eric Marc Levine operates fitness clubs in Asia and has registered at least 15 companies in the British Virgin Islands through Mossack Fonseca. The Thai [[Anti-Money Laundering Office (Thailand)|Anti-Money Laundering Office]] froze some of his business assets following fraud allegations; Levine responded with a defamation suit. * Former Newfoundland Cabinet minister [[Chuck Furey]] incorporated in Panama to buy a condo in 2008. He said no longer has overseas holdings. * Mixed martial arts trainer Dave Feser of Vancouver set up a business in British Anguilla with an office in Switzerland. "There's nothing even associated with this company," Feser told the ''Star''.
Canadians for Tax Fairness had calculated that legal tax avoidance by corporations alone cost the Canadian treasury almost $8 billion Canadian a year.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2016/04/06/homegrown-loopholes-cost-canada-more-than-panama-tax-havens-walkom.html |title=Homegrown loopholes cost Canada more than Panama tax havens: Walkom |date=April 6, 2016 |accessdate=April 30, 2016 |publisher=The Star |author=Thomas Walkom |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160411173439/http://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2016/04/06/homegrown-loopholes-cost-canada-more-than-panama-tax-havens-walkom.html |archivedate=April 11, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> When it calculated the 2015 numbers, they found that corporations and individuals combined sent CAN$40 billion of declared assets to tax havens, and the ten most popular alone now held $270 billion Canadian in assets.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2016/04/27/canadians-put-40-billion-in-tax-havens-last-year.html |title=Canadians put $40 billion in tax havens last year: The Panama Papers revelations of widespread use of tax havens are corroborated by Statistics Canada data |author=Marco Chown Oved |publisher=Toronto Star |date=April 27, 2016 |accessdate=April 30, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160429122755/http://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2016/04/27/canadians-put-40-billion-in-tax-havens-last-year.html |archivedate=April 29, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==== Costa Rica ==== The administration of President [[Luis Guillermo Solís]] suggested that some of the activity unveiled by the leaked documents suggests attempts to [[tax evasion|evade taxes]]. His administration's effort to implement tax increases and reforms has met strong resistance from opposition and business figures.<ref name=TT>{{cite news |url=http://www.ticotimes.net/2016/04/05/costa-rica-panama-papers-leak |title=Costa Rica in the Panama Papers leak |date=April 5, 2016 |accessdate=April 29, 2016 |work=The Tico Times News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425233246/http://www.ticotimes.net/2016/04/05/costa-rica-panama-papers-leak |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Leaked documents suggest that Mossack Fonseca helped tuna export company Borda Azul set up a shell company in the British Virgin Islands in order to avoid Costa Rican taxes. The firm, now out of business, was headed by Hermes Navarro, president of the [[Costa Rican Football Federation]] from 1999 to 2006.<ref name=TT /> In the late 1990s the Finance Ministry and Prosecutor's Office investigated Borda Azul and other export companies for allegedly misusing tax credit certificates; in 1997 dozens of companies had been accused of using the certificates for fraud and to launder drug profits.<ref name=TT />
According to ICIJ investigative partners DataBaseAR and Seminario Universidad, Mossack Fonseca helped Borda Azul fabricate invoices to allow it to report both inflated costs—to reduce its taxes—and inflated exports, to allow it to continue to qualify for the tax credit certificates. In a letter dated October 19, 1998, a Mossack Fonseca lawyer explained the investigation to the Panama City office and concluded:
{{Quote|In the worst of circumstances, being very fatalistic, the Costa Rican government could, after years of investigation, suspend the transfer of CATs to Borda Azul for irregularities but never send anyone to jail. |source=a Mossack Fonseca lawyer<ref name=TT />}}
More than thirty Costa Rican law firms are mentioned in the Panama Papers as referring clients to Mossack Fonseca, resulting in the creation of more than 360 shell companies. in particular Gonzalo Fajardo & Asociados, founded by former Finance Ministry official and later Economy Minister Gonzalo Fajardo Salas, and over nearly two decades helped Costa Rican companies set up 82 offshore corporations in tax havens, according to DataBaseAR.<ref name=TT />
Finance Vice Minister Fernando Rodríguez said Costa Rica will push to sign a [[Tax Information Exchange Agreement]] with Panama.<ref name=TTleg>{{cite news |url=http://www.ticotimes.net/2016/04/06/costa-rica-propose-panama-tax-information-exchange-agreement |title=Panama Papers scandal cracks open window for Costa Rica tax reform |date=April 6, 2016 |accessdate=April 29, 2016 |author=L.Arias |work=The Tico Times News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425233200/http://www.ticotimes.net/2016/04/06/costa-rica-propose-panama-tax-information-exchange-agreement |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Legislators from several parties are trying to line up political consensus to seek approval of the administration's tax fraud bill and to form a legislative commission to investigate those named in the Panama Papers, according to [[Emilia Molina Cruz]] of the [[Citizens' Action Party (Costa Rica)|Citizens' Action Party]].<ref name=TTleg /> While opposition parties have maintained that the country's financial problems stem from excess spending, according to the Finance Department, the sums Costa Rica loses to tax evasion equal about 8% of the country's gross domestic product, while its deficits have run at about 6%.<ref name=TTleg />
==== Mexico ==== [[File:14-02-2013 VISITA DE EPN A BAHÍA DE BANDERAS.jpg|thumb|upright|The leaked files identified the "favourite contractor" of Mexican President [[Enrique Peña Nieto]].<ref>[http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/nation-world/national/article69729372.html A well-connected Mexican tycoon stashes a fortune overseas] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406011553/http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/nation-world/national/article69729372.html |date=April 6, 2016 }}". ''[[The McClatchy Company|The McClatchy DC]]''. April 3, 2016.</ref>]] Aristóteles Núñez, who is in charge of the government's tax administration, [[:es:Servicio de Administración Tributaria|Servicio de Administración Tributaria]], said that people involved in the Panama Papers case can still make tax declarations and pay taxes on their investments. Being Mexican and having foreign investments or bank accounts is not a crime, but having income and not declaring it is illegal. If investments are categorized as tax evasion, fines of up to 100% of the omitted tax payment can result, as well as three months to nine years imprisonment.<ref name=AristApr416> {{cite news |url=http://aristeguinoticias.com/0404/mexico/aun-pueden-pagar-impuestos-los-mexicanos-involucrados-en-panama-papers-sat/ |title=Aún pueden pagar impuestos los mexicanos involucrados en Panama Papers: SAT |date=April 4, 2016 |first1=Redaccion |last1=AN |work=Aristegui Noticias |accessdate=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024658/http://aristeguinoticias.com/0404/mexico/aun-pueden-pagar-impuestos-los-mexicanos-involucrados-en-panama-papers-sat/ |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
* Mexican actress [[Edith González]] is linked to the scandal through her husband Lorenzo Lazo Margáin.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.proceso.com.mx/435634/al-desnudo-trafico-clandestino-las-fortunas-prominentes-mexicanos |title=Revista Proceso – ''Al desnudo, el tráfico clandestino de las fortunas de prominentes mexicanos'', 3 abril 2016 |publisher=Proceso.com.mx |date=2016-04-03 |accessdate=2016-05-03 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160504221253/http://www.proceso.com.mx/435634/al-desnudo-trafico-clandestino-las-fortunas-prominentes-mexicanos |archivedate=May 4, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> * [[Ricardo Salinas Pliego]], president of [[Grupo Salinas]], which includes [[Azteca (multimedia conglomerate)|Azteca]], [[Banco Azteca]] and [[Fundación Azteca|Azteca Foundation]] among others, used an offshore company set up in the Virgin Islands to purchase a yacht, Azteca II, flagged in the [[Cayman Islands]].<ref name=BillBraMex>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/kerryadolan/2016/04/14/billionaires-from-brazil-and-mexico-named-in-the-panama-papers-leak/#559828362119 |title=Billionaires From Brazil And Mexico Named In The Panama Papers Leak |author=Kerry A. Dolan |date=April 14, 2016 |accessdate=April 23, 2016 |publisher=Forbes |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422155920/http://www.forbes.com/sites/kerryadolan/2016/04/14/billionaires-from-brazil-and-mexico-named-in-the-panama-papers-leak/#559828362119 |archivedate=April 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Felicitas Holdings Limited, registered in the British Virgin Islands, spent £261 million in 2014 on art by [[Francisco de Goya]] and also bought works by Mexican painter Manuel Serrano; the press director of Grupo Salinas told ''Forbes'' that all of Pliego's transactions complied with the law.<ref name=BillBraMex /> * [[Juan Armando Hinojosa|Juan Armando Hinojosa Cantú]], a close friend of Mexican president [[Enrique Peña Nieto]], enlisted Mossack Fonseca to create trusts for accounts worth US$100 million<ref name=TTLatin /> after he was investigated for allegedly giving special favours to the Mexican president and his wife, according to an analysis by ICIJ, who said that the documents showed "a complex offshore network" of nine companies in New Zealand, the United Kingdom, and the Netherlands.<ref name=campri /> Described as Peña Nieto's "favorite contractor", Hinojosa's companies have won more than eighty government contracts and received at least US$2.8 billion in state money, The ''New York Times'' reported last year.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.businessinsider.com.au/panama-papers-juan-hinojosa-enrique-pena-nieto-mexico-2016-4 |title=Leaked documents show the Mexican president's close friend moved $100 million offshore after a corruption probe |work=[[Business Insider]] |date=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407224046/http://www.businessinsider.com.au/panama-papers-juan-hinojosa-enrique-pena-nieto-mexico-2016-4 |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
According to ''Forbes'', "[[Juan Armando Hinojosa|Hinojosa]] and other prominent Mexicans, mostly businessmen with close ties to the government, including at least one member of the Forbes billionaires list, were the subject of extensive articles published online by ICIJ investigation partners ''[[Proceso (magazine)|Proceso]]'' and ''Aristegui Noticias Sunday''."<ref name="ForbesMex">"[https://www.forbes.com/sites/doliaestevez/2016/04/04/mexican-government-contractor-who-built-first-ladys-mansion-is-exposed-in-the-panama-papers/ Mexican Government Contractor Who Built First Lady's Mansion Is Exposed In The Panama Papers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171018051815/https://www.forbes.com/sites/doliaestevez/2016/04/04/mexican-government-contractor-who-built-first-ladys-mansion-is-exposed-in-the-panama-papers/ |date=October 18, 2017 }}" April 4, 2016.</ref> Proceso also said that the Mexicans mentioned in the leaked documents included individuals linked to drug cartels.<ref name=TTLatin />
==== Trinidad and Tobago ==== Ken Emrith, a member of the opposition [[United National Congress]] (UNC), is linked to a bribery scandal in Brazil through Panamanian shell companies used to transfer millions of US dollars to offshore bank accounts.<ref name=TTBrazcon /> The Brazilian construction company {{Interlanguage link multi|Grupo OAS|pt}} was awarded a contract in 2011 through the National Infrastructure Development Company (NIDCO) by the [[People's Partnership]] administration to build a highway in Trinidad for TT$5.2 billion.<ref group=note>TT$1~US$0.16 as of April 15, 2016.</ref> The highway is 49% complete, but it is now estimated that the highway will cost TT$8 billion when done.<ref name=TTBrazcon /> Investigators have found that Emirth's companies received $6 million from NIDCO and that Emirth was also a director of Pembury Consultants (Trinidad and Tobago) Limited, which OAS hired on the highway project as a consultant at $44,800 a month.<ref name=TTBrazcon /> Through May 2013 OAS paid Pembury at least TT$896,000; totals beyond that date are not currently available.<ref name=TTBrazcon>{{cite news |url=http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/news/T-T-Gov-t-seeking-assistance-in-probing-local-link-to-Panama-Papers |title=T&T Gov't seeking assistance in probing local link to Panama Papers |author=CMC |work=Jamaica Observer |date=April 15, 2016 |accessdate=April 30, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160421085850/http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/news/T-T-Gov-t-seeking-assistance-in-probing-local-link-to-Panama-Papers |archivedate=April 21, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Emrith, described as a low-level UNC party official, had a second Mossack Fonseca company, Pendrey Associates. Speaking in Parliament, Attorney General [[Faris Al-Rawi]] said the leaked documents tied this offshore company to key players in the [[Petrobras]] scandal in Brazil, including the convicted {{Interlanguage link multi|Joao Procopio|pt}}, and Jose Luiz Pires of Queluz, who had dealings with Swiss {{Interlanguage link multi|PKB Privatbank|de}} AG. Pires is under investigation, he said.<ref name=TTBrazcon />
According to ICIJ investigative partner ''Trinidad Express'', Emrith was a close associate of [[Jack Warner (football executive)|Jack Warner]] and also owns half the shares in Proteus Holding SA, an investment he refuses to discuss because he says he has a responsibility of confidentiality to fellow shareholders.<ref name=TEem>{{cite news |url=http://www.trinidadexpress.com/20160416/news/cheap-dummies |title=CHEAP DUMMIES: Emrith paid US$750 for fake directors in shell company Panama... |date=April 16, 2016 |accessdate=April 30, 2016 |author=Camini Marajh |work=Trinidad Express |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160421090255/http://www.trinidadexpress.com/20160416/news/cheap-dummies |archivedate=April 21, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The ''Express'' also says that OAS used a Namibian port development project as camouflage for a $1 million payment from Procopio shell company Santa Tereza Services Ltd to Emirth.<ref name=TEem />
==== United States ==== {{See also |United States as a tax haven}}
President [[Barack Obama]] was critical of Caribbean tax havens in his 2008 election campaign.<ref name="Hockney2014">{{cite book |first=Mike |last=Hockney |title=All the Rest Is Propaganda |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=BGFdCAAAQBAJ&pg=PT168 |date=September 12, 2014 |work=Lulu.com |isbn=978-1-326-01638-8 |page=168 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161122090909/https://books.google.com/books?id=BGFdCAAAQBAJ&pg=PT168 |archivedate=November 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> In 2010, the United States implemented the [[Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act]]; the law required financial firms around the world to report accounts held by US citizens to the [[Internal Revenue Service]].
The US on the other hand refused to sign on to the [[Common Reporting Standard]] set up by the [[Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development]], alongside [[Vanuatu]] and [[Bahrain]].<ref name="SwansonApr5">{{cite news |last1=Swanson |first1=Ana |title=How the U.S. became one of the world's biggest tax havens |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2016/04/05/how-the-u-s-became-one-of-the-worlds-biggest-tax-havens/ |accessdate=April 23, 2016 |work=Washington Post |date=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160421005012/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2016/04/05/how-the-u-s-became-one-of-the-worlds-biggest-tax-havens/ |archivedate=April 21, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> This means the US receives tax and asset information for American assets and income abroad, but does not share information about what happens in the United States with other countries, which in other words means that the United States has become attractive as a tax haven.
At least 2,400 US-based clients were found in the papers and many of their transactions were legal, however Mossack Fonseca offered advice to many of its US clients on how to evade US tax and financial disclosure laws.<ref>ERIC LIPTON and JULIE CRESWELL (June 5, 2016) [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/06/us/panama-papers.html Panama Papers Show How Rich United States Clients Hid Millions Abroad] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170226072101/https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/06/us/panama-papers.html |date=February 26, 2017 }} The New York Times, Retrieved 6 June 2016.</ref>
===== Panama Free Trade Agreement =====
The [[Panama–United States Trade Promotion Agreement|Panama Free Trade Agreement]],<!-- Majority of sources use phrase "Panama Free Trade Agreement --> supported by Obama and Clinton, has been accused of enabling the practices detailed within the Panama Papers through regulatory oversight.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Mindock |first1=Clark |title=Panama Papers: Obama, Clinton Pushed Trade Deal Amid Warnings It Would Make Money Laundering, Tax Evasion Worse |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/panama-papers-obama-clinton-pushed-trade-deal-amid-warnings-it-would-make-money-2348076 |work=International Business Times |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425114027/http://www.ibtimes.com/panama-papers-obama-clinton-pushed-trade-deal-amid-warnings-it-would-make-money-2348076 |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> However, an Obama administration official said the argument has "zero merit".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Mauldin |first1=William |last2=Viswanatha |first2=Aruna |title=Sanders Says U.S. Helped Panama as a Tax Haven But Skips Over Tax Pact |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/sanders-say-u-s-helped-panama-as-a-tax-haven-but-skips-over-tax-pact-1460058370 |accessdate=April 24, 2016 |work=Wall Street Journal |date=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423161258/http://www.wsj.com/articles/sanders-say-u-s-helped-panama-as-a-tax-haven-but-skips-over-tax-pact-1460058370 |archivedate=April 23, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> John Cassidy of ''[[The New Yorker]],'' said the Panama Free Trade Agreement actually forced Panama to release information to the American regulatory authorities on "the ownership of companies, partnerships, trusts, foundations, and other persons".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.newyorker.com/news/john-cassidy/panama-papers-why-arent-there-more-american-names |title=Panama Papers: Why Aren't There More American Names? |last=Cassidy |first=John |date=April 5, 2016 |newspaper=The New Yorker |issn=0028-792X |access-date=April 18, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160424061651/http://www.newyorker.com/news/john-cassidy/panama-papers-why-arent-there-more-american-names |archivedate=April 24, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><!-- deleting eoin higgins again, no evidence he is anything other than some dude with an MA that isn't even in business, and I looked pretty hard. If you know otherwise please explain on talk page -->
Citing leaked diplomatic cables, ''Fortune'' writer Chris Matthews speculated that Obama and Clinton may have supported the agreement, after opposing it while campaigning for office, because it was a ''[[quid pro quo]]'' for Panamanian support of US efforts against drug trafficking. In any event, he notes, while it is true that the agreement abolished limits on fund transfers between the US and Panama, the Obama administration insisted that the two countries first sign a [[Tax information exchange agreement|Tax Information and Exchange Agreement]] as well, which facilitated the exchange of tax information between the countries.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://fortune.com/2016/04/08/panama-papers-sanders-clinton/ |title=Panama Papers: Why Did Clinton and Obama Flip Flop on Trade with Panama |first=Chris |last=Matthews |date=April 8, 2016 |accessdate=April 20, 2016 |work=Fortune |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423073913/http://fortune.com/2016/04/08/panama-papers-sanders-clinton/ |archivedate=April 23, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===== After the leak =====
President Barack Obama addressed the overseas shell companies listed by the leak in a press conference: "It's not that they're breaking the laws," he said, "it's that the laws are so poorly designed that they allow people, if they've got enough lawyers and enough accountants, to wiggle out of responsibilities that ordinary citizens are having to abide by."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Boland-Rudder |first1=Hamish |last2=Holmes |first2=Allan |last3=Chittum |first3=Ryan |title=Impact of Panama Papers rockets around the world; U.S. officials react cautiously |url=https://www.publicintegrity.org/2016/04/05/19526/white-house-and-us-officials-react-cautiously-panama-papers |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160529034506/https://www.publicintegrity.org/2016/04/05/19526/white-house-and-us-officials-react-cautiously-panama-papers |archivedate=2016-05-29 |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |work=Center for Public Integrity}}</ref> Although no leader in the US was mentioned in the Panama Papers, Obama said that "Frankly, folks in America are taking advantage of the same stuff".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Revesz |first1=Rachael |title=Obama says Americans are doing the same Panama Papers tax avoidance as everyone else |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/panama-papers-tax-avoidance-obama-says-frankly-americans-are-doing-the-same-a6970106.html |accessdate=April 23, 2016 |work=The Independent |date=April 5, 2016 |location=New York, United States |language=English |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160424225248/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/panama-papers-tax-avoidance-obama-says-frankly-americans-are-doing-the-same-a6970106.html |archivedate=April 24, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Senators [[Sherrod Brown]] and [[Elizabeth Warren]] have requested that the [[United States Department of the Treasury|Treasury Department]] investigate any US-linked companies that appeared in the leaks, in addition to the Justice Department, given its role in the financial markets.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2016-04-07/treasury-should-probe-u-s-banks-on-panama-papers-senators-say |title=Treasury Should Probe U.S. Banks on Panama Papers, Warren and Brown Say |author=Steven T. Dennis |date=April 7, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160509034821/http://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2016-04-07/treasury-should-probe-u-s-banks-on-panama-papers-senators-say |archivedate=May 9, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>

Thanks, User:Zumoarirodoka -->Former Secretary of State and 2016 [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] presidential candidate [[Hillary Clinton]] condemned "outrageous tax havens and loopholes ... in Panama and elsewhere"<ref name=CBSafl>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/hillary-attacks-sanders-china-in-speech-to-union/ |title=Hillary attacks Sanders, China in speech to union |author=Hannah Fraser-Chanpong |accessdate=April 24, 2016 |date=April 6, 2016 |work=CBS News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160415162028/http://www.cbsnews.com/news/hillary-attacks-sanders-china-in-speech-to-union/ |archivedate=April 15, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> at a [[Pennsylvania AFL–CIO]] event. Clinton added that "some of this behavior is clearly against the law, and everyone who violates the law anywhere should be held accountable", but it was "scandalous how much is actually legal".<ref name=CBSafl /> Clinton promised that "We are going after all these scams and make sure everyone pays their fair share here in America."<ref name=CBSafl /><!-- END -->
Manhattan US Attorney [[Preet Bharara]] has opened a criminal investigation on matters related to the Panama Papers and sent a letter April 3 to the [[International Consortium of Investigative Journalists]] (ICIJ) saying his office "would greatly appreciate the opportunity to speak as soon as possible."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.i24news.tv/en/news/international/110445-160420-us-opens-criminal-probe-linked-to-panama-paper-revelations-icij |title=US opens criminal probe linked to Panama Paper revelations: ICIJ |author=AFP |work=i24 News |date=April 20, 2016 |accessdate=April 20, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160505070759/http://www.i24news.tv/en/news/international/110445-160420-us-opens-criminal-probe-linked-to-panama-paper-revelations-icij |archivedate=May 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The ICIJ received many such requests from many countries and ICIJ Director Gerard Ryle has said its policy is not to turn over any materials.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://panamapapers.icij.org/20160412-global-tax-officials-meeting.html |first=Martha M. |last=Hamilton |title=Global joint investigation to be proposed at special tax meeting |date=April 12, 2016 |accessdate=April 21, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160505145116/https://panamapapers.icij.org/20160412-global-tax-officials-meeting.html |archivedate=May 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=Cura>[http://curacaochronicle.com/economy/ny-banks-ordered-to-provide-information-on-panama-dealings/ "NY banks ordered to provide information on Panama dealings"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160504064939/http://curacaochronicle.com/economy/ny-banks-ordered-to-provide-information-on-panama-dealings/ |date=May 4, 2016 }}. ''Curaçao Chronicle''.</ref>
[[New York City|New York]]'s Department of Financial Services has asked 13 foreign banks, including [[Deutsche Bank AG]], [[Credit Suisse Group AG]], [[Commerzbank AG]], [[ABN Amro Group NV]] and [[Societe Generale|Societe Generale SA]], for information about their dealings with Mossack Fonseca. The banks are not accused of wrongdoing but must provide telephone logs and records of other transactions between their New York branches and the law firm.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-04-20/ny-regulator-asks-banks-for-records-linked-to-panama-papers-firm |title=New York Wants Foreign Banks to Hand Over Panama Records |first1=Greg |last1=Farrell |first2=Tom |last2=Schoenberg |first3=Katherine |last3=Chiglinsy |date=April 20, 2016 |accessdate=April 20, 2016 |work=Bloomberg |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160421150458/http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-04-20/ny-regulator-asks-banks-for-records-linked-to-panama-papers-firm |archivedate=April 21, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===== Americans =====
[[McClatchy Newspapers]] initially found four Americans with offshore shell companies named in the documents. All had previously been either accused or convicted of financial crimes such as fraud or tax evasion.<ref name=SeattleUS/> Three reasons have been suggested to explain the scarcity of Americans in the leak:<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-35966612 |title=Panama Papers: Where are the Americans? |date=April 6, 2016 |accessdate=April 6, 2016 |work=BBC News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406162046/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-35966612 |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
* Shell companies can be created in the United States. * Major international banks based in America tend to have offshore accounts in the Cayman Islands instead. * US laws like the [[Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act]] (FATCA) and the [[Tax information exchange agreement|Tax Information Exchange Agreements]] (TIEAs) of 2010 have meant that the "tax evasion game [was] principally over for American taxpayers".
Asked about the paucity of American individuals in the documents, digital editor of ''[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]],'' Stefan Plöchinger, said via Twitter: "Just wait for what is coming next."<ref>{{cite news |title=Everyone is freaking out about the Panama Papers—but the biggest fallout is yet to come |url=https://www.motherjones.com/kevin-drum/2016/04/panama-papers-offshore-tax-havens-are-getting-their-day-spotlight |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |work=Mother Jones |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407150525/https://www.motherjones.com/kevin-drum/2016/04/panama-papers-offshore-tax-havens-are-getting-their-day-spotlight |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Plöchinger later clarified that he was just advocating not jumping to conclusions.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/04/04/why-are-there-no-us-people-in-the-panama-papers-5794114/ |title=Why are there no US people in the Panama papers? |date=April 4, 2016 |first=Jen |last=Mills |work=Metro |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160404230504/http://metro.co.uk/2016/04/04/why-are-there-no-us-people-in-the-panama-papers-5794114/ |archivedate=April 4, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Copies of at least 200 American passports – indicating that their owners applied for banking services – have been discovered in the Papers, but no US politicians have yet been named in the leak.<ref name="Power Players"/><ref name=SeattleUS/> The names of a few Americans are however mentioned:
* Puerto Rican recording artist Ramón Luis Ayala, better known as [[Daddy Yankee]], appears in the leaked documents.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://fusion.net/story/288251/panama-papers-leak-celebrities-list-of-names/ |title=Here are the most famous celebrities with ties to the huge Panama Papers leak |first1=Danielle |last1=Wiener-Bronner |first2=David |last2=Matthews |author3=Fusion Investigative Unit |date=April 6, 2016 |accessdate=April 17, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160416153811/http://fusion.net/story/288251/panama-papers-leak-celebrities-list-of-names/ |archivedate=April 16, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> * CEO and then Chairman of [[Citibank]] (1998–2006) [[Sanford I. Weill]] appears in the documents as sole shareholder of April Fool, a company based in the British Virgin Islands that managed a yacht of the same name from 2001–2005. Weill's second company, Brightao, includes Chinese and American investors and holds share in a Chinese insurance and risk-management firm, Mingya Insurance Brokers. * Jerry Slusser, a fundraiser for Republican [[Mitt Romney]], initially said he did not recall opening an offshore company, but then called his accountant and said it was for an investment in Hong Kong that eventually showed a loss.<ref name=ST>{{cite news |url=http://www.seattletimes.com/nation-world/offshore-havens-tied-to-some-in-us/ |title=Panama Papers revelations expose ultra-rich Americans |date=April 6, 2016 |accessdate=April 27, 2016 |author1=Marisa Taylor |author2=Kevin G. === South America ===
==== Argentina ====
===== Mauricio Macri ===== [[File:Presidente Macri en el Sillon de Rivadavia (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Argentine President [[Mauricio Macri]] ]] Argentine president [[Mauricio Macri]] is listed as head of a trading company based in the Bahamas that he did not disclose during his tenure as [[Chief of Government of Buenos Aires|Mayor of Buenos Aires]]; it is not clear whether disclosure of non-equity directorships was then required under Argentine law.<ref name="Fusion: Wikileaks of the mega-rich" />
On April 7, 2016, federal prosecutor Federico Delgado began a formal investigation into Macri's involvement with Fleg Trading Ltd., the company registered in Panama for which President Macri was listed as director. Judge [[Sebastián Casanello]] was asked to start the file on the inquiry.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/ultimas/20-296426-2016-04-07.html |title=Macri, imputado por las cuentas offshore |publisher=Pagina 12 |access-date=2016-04-07 |date=April 7, 2016 |trans-title=Macri, charged with offshore accounts |language=Spanish |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407165357/http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/ultimas/20-296426-2016-04-07.html |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The initial petition was made by [[Neuquén Province|Neuquén]] representative Darío Martínez. Martínez claims Macri could be guilty of perjury due to omissions in his sworn statement.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1887050-imputaron-a-mauricio-macri-por-su-participacion-en-una-sociedad-offshore |title=Panamá Papers: imputaron a Mauricio Macri por su participación en una sociedad offshore |website=www.lanacion.com.ar |access-date=2016-04-07 |date=April 7, 2016 |trans-title=Papers Panama: Mauricio Macri charged to its participation in an offshore company |language=Spanish |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407224017/http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1887050-imputaron-a-mauricio-macri-por-su-participacion-en-una-sociedad-offshore |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Martínez also referenced another offshore company, Kagemusha SA (named after [[Akira Kurosawa]]'s [[Kagemusha|1980 film]]), which was established in 1981 and to which President Macri also had connections.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1885839-macri-fue-director-de-una-sociedad-offshore-de-bahamas |trans-title=Macri was director of an offshore company in the Bahamas |language=Spanish |title=Macri fue director de una sociedad offshore de Bahamas |website=www.lanacion.com.ar |access-date=2016-04-07 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407150726/http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1885839-macri-fue-director-de-una-sociedad-offshore-de-bahamas |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.perfil.com/politica/Mauricio-Macri-aparece-como-director-una-segunda-empresa-offshore-20160404-0029.html |trans-title=Macri offshore: appears a second company president in Panama |title=Macri offshore: aparece una segunda empresa del presidente en Panamá - Perfil.com |website=Perfil.com |language=es-LA |access-date=2016-04-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407224017/http://www.perfil.com/politica/Mauricio-Macri-aparece-como-director-una-segunda-empresa-offshore-20160404-0029.html |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> An investigation by news outlets ''El Destape'' and ''InfoEconomico'' at the end of April found however that Macri had been involved in at least eight other holding companies, at least seven founded and run by his friends and relatives through Mossack Fonseca. Most are active; at least one is only a year old.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/Macri-and-His-Father-Linked-to-More-Panama-Papers-Firms-20160420-0032.html |title=Macri and His Father Linked to More Panama Papers Firms |date=April 20, 2016 |accessdate=May 1, 2016 |publisher=TeleSUR |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160504073533/http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/Macri-and-His-Father-Linked-to-More-Panama-Papers-Firms-20160420-0032.html |archivedate=May 4, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===== Néstor Kirchner and Cristina Fernández de Kirchner ===== Daniel Muñoz, the private secretary and confidant of former Argentinian president [[Néstor Kirchner]] later also served for two years as an aide to Néstor Kirchner's wife, [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]], who was president of Argentina from 2007 to 2015. Muñoz and his wife were linked to Gold Black Limited, a company incorporated in the British Virgin Islands in 2010 to invest in US real estate. The origin of the company's funds was listed as "personal savings". From 2010 to the beginning of 2015, the company's ownership was through bearer shares, a financial instrument that can be used to hide an owner's identity. One of the directors, Sergio Tadisco, told ICIJ partner Canal Trece that he was just a figurehead who said he agreed to his name being used in 2011 because of his friendship with Muñoz and his wife. In January 2015, Muñoz and his wife became named shareholders, owning 50 percent each. By that time, Mossack Fonseca had become the registered agent of Gold Black. However, only three weeks later, its compliance department proposed resigning because Muñoz was identified in connection with the governments of the Kirchners. The resignation became effective in June 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://panamapapers.icij.org/the_power_players/|title=The Power Players|access-date=2017-07-16|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160404030817/https://panamapapers.icij.org/the_power_players/|archivedate=April 4, 2016|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://noticias.perfil.com/2013/05/07/quien-es-daniel-munoz-el-valijero-de-kirchner/|title=Quién es Daniel Muñoz, el "valijero" de Kirchner {{!}} Revista Noticias|access-date=2017-07-16|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170907160557/http://noticias.perfil.com/2013/05/07/quien-es-daniel-munoz-el-valijero-de-kirchner/|archivedate=September 7, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1885925-panama-papers-los-kirchner-se-desvincularon-de-la-investigacion-sobre-sociedades-offshore|title=Panama Papers: los Kirchner se desvincularon de la investigación sobre sociedades offshore|access-date=2017-07-16|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171002073628/http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1885925-panama-papers-los-kirchner-se-desvincularon-de-la-investigacion-sobre-sociedades-offshore|archivedate=October 2, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
In 2009, Muñoz was investigated for illicit enrichment, a charge that was later dropped. In 2013, Argentinian media reported that Muñoz had helped transfer "bags of money" belonging to President Néstor Kirchner from Buenos Aires, the Argentine capital, to Santa Cruz, the Kirchner's home state. Charges in relation to the matter were dismissed in July 2015 for lack of evidence.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.clarin.com/politica/piloto-confirmo-vuelos-secretario-kirchner_0_HyngMUOov7x.html |title=Un piloto confirmó los vuelos con dinero del secretario de Kirchner |last=Clarin.com |website=www.clarin.com |language=es |access-date=2017-07-16 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171012202312/https://www.clarin.com/politica/piloto-confirmo-vuelos-secretario-kirchner_0_HyngMUOov7x.html |archivedate=October 12, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> On May 25, 2016 he died from a cancer that he had for the last four years.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.urgente24.com/252997-murio-daniel-munoz-senalado-como-valijero-de-kirchner |title=Murió Daniel Muñoz, señalado como 'valijero' de Kirchner |work=Urgente24 |access-date=2017-07-16 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171013014101/https://www.urgente24.com/252997-murio-daniel-munoz-senalado-como-valijero-de-kirchner |archivedate=October 13, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>

==== Brazil ==== Five billionaires from Brazil, the sons of two Brazilian billionaires, and four former billionaire Brazilian families appear in the Panama Papers leak, according to [[Forbes]]. The Brazilian news website [[Universo Online|UOL]] has access to the leaked documents and has published an article and a list. Like many Panama Paper reports, their story cautions that some of the people mentioned in the documents may be doing nothing wrong: "In general there is nothing illegal per se in having an offshore company and in fact it is very common for an international business to set one up for transactions and joint ventures when they're doing business all over the world," said Brazil-based Marcello Hallake, a Brazil-based partner of the law firm [[Jones Day]].<ref name=bill>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/kerryadolan/2016/04/14/billionaires-from-brazil-and-mexico-named-in-the-panama-papers-leak/#78466d412119 |title=Billionaires From Brazil And Mexico Named In The Panama Papers Leak |date=14 April 2016 |accessdate=19 April 2016 |author=Kerry Dolan |publisher=Forbes |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422155920/http://www.forbes.com/sites/kerryadolan/2016/04/14/billionaires-from-brazil-and-mexico-named-in-the-panama-papers-leak/#78466d412119 |archivedate=April 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
However, six out of ten members of Congress now face one criminal investigation or another.<ref name=WSJBrazil>{{cite news |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/brazils-giant-problem-1461359723?tesla=y&mod=e2tw |title=Brazil's Giant Problem |publisher=''Wall Street Journal'' |accessdate=April 24, 2016 |date=April 22, 2016 |author1=John Lyons |author2=David Luhnow |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160513164422/http://www.wsj.com/articles/brazils-giant-problem-1461359723?tesla=y&mod=e2tw |archivedate=May 13, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> High-profile construction executives and a senator are among the 84 people arrested in the [[Petrobras]] scandal,<ref name=WSJBrazil /> a number that reflects the job protections in the 1988 Constitution for judges and prosecutors.<ref name=WSJBrazil />
Three men ([[Marcel Herrmann Telles]], [[Carlos Alberto Sicupira]] and Jorge Felipe Lemann, son of their long-time business partner [[Jorge Paulo Lemann]], Brazil's richest man and a controlling shareholder of [[Anheuser-Busch InBev]]) set up three offshore companies in the British Virgin Islands and the Bahamas tied to private equity firm [[3G]] and to beer firm Ambev, a unit of Anheuser-Busch Inbev, according to UOL. Two of the companies are no longer active and the men are no longer tied with the third. They told UOL the companies had been publicly disclosed and registered. Documents described Lemann as an advisor to Brazilian firm Sao Carlos. His father and father's business partners own a controlling stake.<ref name="bill"/>
The Panama Papers reveal that a former [[Supreme Federal Court|Supreme Court judge]], [[Joaquim Barbosa]],<ref>[http://www.diariodocentrodomundo.com.br/joaquim-barbosa-e-o-primeiro-destaque-brasileiro-no-chamado-panama-papers/ Joaquim Barbosa é o primeiro destaque brasileiro no escândalo da Mossack Fonseca.] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160416233611/http://www.diariodocentrodomundo.com.br/joaquim-barbosa-e-o-primeiro-destaque-brasileiro-no-chamado-panama-papers/ |date=April 16, 2016 }} by Paulo Nogueira in "Diario do Centro do Mundo" newspaper (2016) {{pt}}</ref> bought an apartment in downtown Miami.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Nehamas |first1=Nicholas |title=Brazil's former top judge hid price he paid for Miami condo |url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/business/real-estate-news/article69248772.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160424161452/http://www.miamiherald.com/news/business/real-estate-news/article69248772.html |archivedate=2016-04-24|access-date=5 April 2016 |publisher=[[Miami Herald]] |date=3 April 2016}}</ref>
Police raided the [[São Paulo]] offices of Mossack Fonseca in January 2016, seeking records about offshore companies the firm opened for two former executives of Petróleo Brasileiro S.A. ([[Petrobras]]) who were convicted in 2015 of corruption and money laundering. Police say the companies were used to hide illegally diverted funds.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/moneybeat/2016/04/05/panama-leak-involves-firm-probed-in-petrobras-scandal-energy-journal/ |title=Panama Leak Involves Firm Probed in Petrobras Scandal — Energy Journal |author=Christopher Harder |date=April 5, 2016 |accessdate=April 18, 2016 |publisher=Wall Street Journal |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160412041544/http://blogs.wsj.com/moneybeat/2016/04/05/panama-leak-involves-firm-probed-in-petrobras-scandal-energy-journal/ |archivedate=April 12, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===== Operation Car Wash ===== In January 2016, even before the Panama Papers were published, the Brazilian Federal Police, as part of a corruption investigation known as [[Operation Car Wash]], had already accused Mossack Fonseca's law firm of helping suspects create offshore entities to hide corrupt money. They alleged that the firm used a real estate company to help hide criminal proceeds from the scheme involving [[Petrobras]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Blankfeld |first1=Karen |title=Law Firm At Center of Panama Papers Leak Was Implicated In Brazil Corruption Scandal In January |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/kerenblankfeld/2016/04/04/law-firm-at-center-of-panama-papers-leak-was-implicated-in-brazil-corruption-scandal-in-january/ |accessdate=April 20, 2016 |work=[[Forbes]] |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://wayback.archive-it.org/all/20171018055159/https://www.forbes.com/sites/kerenblankfeld/2016/04/04/law-firm-at-center-of-panama-papers-leak-was-implicated-in-brazil-corruption-scandal-in-january/ |archivedate=October 18, 2017 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
====== Impeachment ====== The leak complicated an already volatile political situation in Brazil, where a tanking economy had led to calls for the impeachment of President [[Dilma Rousseff]] amid many revelations of political corruption.
